intro: Elatostema manillense var. panayanum, commonly known as the Philippine stellaria, is a small herbaceous plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, hairy leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white flowers with five petals, which bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
